Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Dispute_Type: Complaint of discrimination based on age and sex
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of CHRC's dismissal decision
Standard_of_Review: Reasonable basis for proceeding to tribunal, procedural fairness, evidence sufficiency
Evidence_Requirement: Sufficient evidence to support a reasonable basis for hearing
Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; CHRC's decision upheld
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness of CHRC's decision, procedural fairness
Complaint_Issues: Alleged systemic discrimination in reorganization and termination
Legal_Standard: Reasonable basis for referral to tribunal under CHRA
Protection_Claim: Right to be free from employment discrimination based on age and sex
State_Protection_Assessment: CHRC assessed and found insufficient basis to proceed
Credibility: No explicit finding of lack of credibility; insufficient evidence noted
State_Protection_Adequacy: Deemed adequate through CHRC's procedural review
Enforcement_Action: Investigation conducted, complaints dismissed without referral to tribunal
Legal_Basis: Violation of Canadian Human Rights Act on grounds of age and sex
